author: 自由時報電子報
title: 大學繁星、申請放榜 斗六高中逾7成上國立大學8人錄取醫學領域
text:
大學繁星、申請放榜 斗六高中逾7成上國立大學8人錄取醫學領域
114學年度大學繁星、申請入學放榜，斗六高中表現亮眼，錄取國立頂尖大學較往年增加3成。（斗六高中提供）
〔記者黃淑莉／雲林報導〕114學年度大學繁星、個人申請入學今（12）日放榜，斗六高中表現優異，應屆畢業生逾7成錄取國立大學，另有8人錄取醫學、牙醫及中醫系。
學測滿60分滿級分的陳月恆成功上榜中國醫藥大學中醫學系，申請錄取4所醫學系的王博彥最終選擇成功大學醫學系，另6人分別錄取陽明交通大學醫學系、高雄醫學大學牙醫系、中國醫藥大學醫學系、中山醫學大學醫學系、輔仁大學醫學系等。
請繼續往下閱讀...
斗六高中代理校長鐘源旺表示，除了8名學生醫學、牙醫、中醫系金榜題名，今年逾7成錄取國立大學，其中台大、清華、陽明交大、成大、政大、中央、中正、中山、中興等頂尖國立大學的人數比去年成長3成。
校方指出，今年高分群學生中有部分選擇就業市場最夯的電機、光電、資工等學系，顯示學生對未來職業發展更有自己想法。

author: cornwalllive@reachplc.com (Olivier Vergnault)
title: Storm Darragh causes power cables to SPARK after covering them in sea salt
text:
Storm Darragh certainly did a number on Cornwall last weekend. Not only did it bring trees down, close roads, cover the streets of coastal towns with tonnes of sand and cause lengthy power cuts, but it also messed up the power grid.
Many people have been complaining that their lights have been flickering since the storm, but there are now concerns over sparking powerlines. From Hayle to Newquay, residents have taken to social media to wonder why the power lines are still sparking days after Storm Darragh has passed.
On a post on the public page Newest Newquay, Pauline Fillery said she spoke to two National Grid engineers out doing repairs in Cubert who told her the salt build up along the lines accumulated from Storm Darragh is the reason why the lines are sparking.
She posted: "I have news from two National Grid men currently in Cubert. This is what's really going on with the power. Due to the storm last weekend it has caused a build up of salt on the power lines. They said it's built up and tracking along the lines, causing the power to trip.
Sign up to receive daily updates and breaking news alerts from CornwallLive straight to your inbox
"Also there are lots of sparking of power lines due to the salt. They said they are getting on top of it but it's random where and when it happens. They need it to rain to wash the salt off. They said that sticky salty stuff that's coated our windows, is what is coating the power lines."
Gary Price added: "All the power lines are supported by either glass or ceramic discs that act as insulators to the steel pylons. Build up of salt can cause power to track to steelwork on the tower. Some companies power wash them off if lines are isolated. Rain will generally keep them rinsed off of salt and sand build up."
Wolf Akuma saw the funny side of it, adding: "Damn, so we need another storm to fix the first storm and the root of all our problems is cloudy, white, sticky and salty? Gotcha!"
According to scientific open access publishing site MDPI, "over time, atmospheric contaminants, such as salt spray or chemical dust, can build up on an insulator, creating a conductive path that can cause a high-voltage electric discharge known as a flashover. Flashovers can be dangerous or even fatal if a person is too close to the insulator when it occurs".
Hayle resident Lee Nicholas sent CornwallLive a video of sparking powerlines near the Asda store in the town. You can hear little pop sounds and see flashes where the lines are connected to the pylons.
National Grid has confirmed that it is indeed the case that salt incrustation is causing the sparking adding that they are on top of it. A spokesperson for the utility company said rain would be welcome to clean it all off, but the forecast is not promising for the next few days. They insisted it poses no danger to people and properties.
The utility firm said what happened is rare but can happen from time to time and was made worse by the storm and wind direction which pulled a lot of moisture from the sea. They said: "During Storm Darragh strong winds at some costal locations and high grounds led to sea salt crystals coating overhead lines.
"This is an unusual occurrence due to the exceptionally strong northern westerly winds experienced during the storm that pulled moisture from the sea.
"We would like to reassure our customers that we are aware of the issue and are taking action. We will continue to monitor the situation closely."
Click here to join CornwallLive on WhatsApp. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don’t like our community, you can check out any time you like. If you’re curious, you can read our Privacy Notice.

author: virnab
title: Re: new install nestcam outdoor and floodlight, google home does not see devices
text:
Sunday
Bought a nestcam outdoor and floodlight and cannot install with google app. I have other nest products that I use with the nest app. There 2 are recent purchases so I have to use the google home app. I'm literally 2 inches from the camera, light is flashing blue and it does not see the camera. I tried the qr code on camera, and even manually entering set up code, no luck. This is a first time install with google home and there are no other devices connected. I can't even pass the 1st step, it searches for cameras near me and nothing comes up. I am using on iphone
38m ago
Hi zenga,
Thank you for reaching out to our community.
I’m sorry to hear that you can’t install your Nest Cam with floodlights using the Google Home app. I can see you have other Nest products that you use with the Nest app, and because of your recent purchases of two Google devices, you have to use the Google Home app. Thank you for sharing with us these important details, such as the distance you are from the camera to set it up, the symptoms the camera is showing, and some of the steps you have taken to set the camera up through your iPhone. I would be more than pleased to help you with this inconvenience, so don't worry.
Before we get started with further troubleshooting, let me ask you some important questions:
How far is the Nest Cam with floodlights from the router?
Are you getting any error messages on your Google Home app? If so, please describe it.
Are there devices or appliances (such as baby monitors, microwaves, cordless phones, etc.) near the device you want to pair?
Could you please double-check if your Google Nest devices and your iPhone are connected to the same WiFi network?
Is Bluetooth enabled on your iPhone?
Is the Nest Cam with floodlights connected to a 2.4 GHz frequency?
Is the local network enabled for the Google Home app?
In case you would need to know how to enable the local network for the Google Home app, here are the instructions:
From your iPhone's settings, enable Local Network for the Google Home app:
Thanks for your kind attention. I will be looking forward to your response.
Best regards,
Virna

author: Jack Magargee
title: UC Santa Barbara Students Set Up Gaza War Protest Camp Peacefully - The Santa Barbara Independent
text:
News Community UC Santa Barbara Students Set Up Gaza War Protest Camp Peacefully Chancellor Sends Message on Conduct, Safety, and Dialogue
By Jack Magargee
Sat May 04, 2024 | 3:31pm Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on X (Opens in new window) Click to email a link to a friend (Opens in new window) Click to print (Opens in new window) Add to Favorites One of about 10 tents forming a pro-Palestinian encampment at UC Santa Barbara. | Credit: Ingrid Bostrom Friday was Day Three of an encampment constructed at UC Santa Barbara, where supporters of Palestinians have engaged in peaceful activism and demonstrations for a cease-fire in the Israel-Gaza conflict.
The encampment began at 4 a.m. on May Day — historically a day recognized for worker protests since it was first celebrated in the United States in 1886 as a part of laborers’ fight for an eight-hour work day. As on university and college campuses nationwide, the encampment at UCSB is informally recognized as a “liberated zone” on the greens in the area between Davidson Library and the chemistry and engineering buildings. The group is asked not to talk to the press, but they include 30-50 university-affiliated individuals who remain in about 10 tents for the day-and-night protest.
The camp has rules. Upon entering, protesters are asked to sign-in — a name or code name suffices — and to give emergency contact information. Organizers ask participants for their confrontation comfort level on a scale of green (least), orange, or red (okay with being arrested). Additionally, the group is instructed not to go off script when sloganeering.
College campuses have been at the forefront of demonstrations in support of Palestinians in Gaza and against Israel, and in some cases violence has occurred and participants arrested. At the University of Southern California (USC) 93 people have been arrested, and at UCLA, violence between pro-Palestine protesters and counter protesters ensued late on April 30. More thatn 2,000 arrests occurred across the nation in recent weeks.
At UCSB, an “unsanctioned rally” on Wednesday and the encampment have been peaceful, attracting a limited presence by Campus Security Officers (CSOs) but great attention from students, who have posted a multitude of photos and videos of the encampment since it began. As of Friday evening, no reports were made of any confrontations. However, the unsanctioned encampment has drawn attention from Chancellor Henry Yang.
The chancellor issued a statement, saying he cherished the long the tradition of student activism and First Amendment rights on UCSB’s campus but also informed students, “Those violating laws and codes of conduct in unsanctioned, illegal, and disruptive activities, whether non-affiliates or members of our campus community, are subject to legal and disciplinary action.”
“Moving forward,” Yang’s letter continued, “we are willing to work with student groups that wish to protest or express their rights and views peacefully, consistent with law and campus conduct policies, without disrupting or interfering with our core educational and research mission.”
Yang was likely referring to protest signs at the MultiCultural Center in February targeted anti-Semitic statements at the Jewish president of Associated Students. That occurrence sparked a Federal Discrimination Probe by the U.S. Department of Education that began in the last week of March and is still ongoing.
“We must ensure campus safety, and respect the right of everyone on campus to feel safe,” Yang wrote. “We recognize that the violence and suffering in the Middle East have caused great distress in our campus community and we urgently hope that a peaceful resolution will be found. We remain committed to dialogue and education, especially where there are strongly held and differing views. As a public university, the University of California welcomes regular reviews of its policies and practices; there is much that can be debated with analytic rigor.”
Sat May 04, 2024 | 22:35pm https://www.independent.com/2024/05/04/uc-santa-barbara-students-camp-in-peace/

organizations.name: santa barbara independent news community uc santa barbara

author: REV. DR. RICHARD HOWELL
title: CHRISTIANITY: God’s peace through prayer
text:
In his letter to the church in Philippi, the Apostle Paul provides timeless wisdom and encouragement for believers facing anxiety and worry.”Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.” Philippians 4:6-7.This passage offers practical steps for dealing with anxiety and the promise of divine peace.
The Problem of Anxiety: Anxiety is a universal human experience that many people face, especially in today’s fast-paced world. It manifests as feelings of unease, worry, or fear, often stemming from uncertainties about the future or situations beyond our control. Common sources of anxiety include concerns about our families, jobs, health, and overall future. The Bible offers a pathway to cope with these feelings, rooted in faith and trust in God.
The Call to Prayer: Paul instructs us to respond to anxiety with prayer. He emphasizes three key elements: prayer, petition, and thanksgiving. Prayer is an invitation to bring our worries and concerns before God. When we pray, we acknowledge our dependence on God and seek His guidance and comfort. Petition involves telling God exactly what we need and what is troubling us. By doing so, we entrust our burdens to Him, knowing that He cares for us. Thanksgiving shifts our focus from our problems to the blessings we have received. By cultivating a thankful heart, we remind ourselves of God’s faithfulness and goodness, which strengthens our faith.
The Promise of God’s Peace: God’s peace is described as transcending all understanding. It is not dependent on our circumstances or our ability to comprehend it fully.
Paul tells us that God’s peace will guard our hearts and minds in Christ Jesus. This imagery suggests protection and security. God’s peace watches over our inner being, keeping us safe from the turmoil of anxiety. Let us commit to bringing our anxieties before God, trusting in His care, and embracing His peace.

author: /cronologia/-/meta/redaccion
title: Diplomáticos hondureños reciben Doctorado Honoris Causa en México
text:
Ciudad de México, México.- La Embajadora de Honduras en México, Sonia Cruz de Aspra, y el cónsul Héctor Amador fueron distinguidos con el título de doctorado honoris causa durante la Cumbre Mundial del Conocimiento “Reunión de Mentes Brillantes”, celebrada en la Ciudad de México.
El reconocimiento fue otorgado por su labor en el servicio exterior y el fortalecimiento de las relaciones diplomáticas, en un evento que reunió a representantes diplomáticos, académicos y líderes de distintos sectores de varios países.
La distinción fue avalada por la Universidad Latinoamericana y del Caribe, el Colegio Internacional de Profesionistas, la Fundación Gandhi y el Centro Universitario Bonpland & Humboldt.
La entrega oficial estuvo a cargo de Omar Alcántara, presidente de la Junta Mundial del Conocimiento.
Durante la ceremonia, la embajadora Cruz de Aspra agradeció el reconocimiento en nombre de la presidenta de Honduras y del canciller de la República, y señaló que este tipo de homenajes también reflejan el esfuerzo colectivo del cuerpo diplomático que representa al país en el exterior.
Así era Walter Vallecilllo, hondureño que murió en EE UU; le diagnosticaron cáncer a inicios de este año
Por su parte, el cónsul Héctor Amador dedicó el doctorado a la comunidad migrante hondureña radicada en el extranjero.
“Este reconocimiento lo recibo como símbolo del sacrificio de quienes dejaron nuestra tierra en busca de un mejor futuro. Muchos no lo lograron y reposan en cementerios clandestinos, lejos de sus hogares. Este doctorado honra sus vidas y refuerza nuestro compromiso de representarlos con dignidad”, expresó.
Este es el segundo doctorado honoris causa que recibe el cónsul Amador en México; en 2024 también fue galardonado por la Fundación Educativa Marcelino Vargas durante la Cumbre Mundial de Educación.
La ceremonia se llevó a cabo en la sede diplomática de Honduras en México y contó con la asistencia de embajadores, congresistas, senadores, magistrados del Poder Judicial mexicano, líderes sindicales y periodistas, quienes también fueron reconocidos por sus aportes en áreas como los derechos humanos, la educación y el desarrollo del conocimiento.
La participación de los representantes hondureños en esta cumbre refuerza el papel del país en espacios multilaterales y destaca el trabajo diplomático que se realiza desde el servicio exterior.

author: Cybernews
title: Serie de vaguadas y humedad debido a un frente frío continuará afectando la zona
text: Una serie de vaguadas en niveles altos continuará generando alta inestabilidad en la atmósfera, la cual se encuentra saturada de humedad debido a un frente frío que se retira lentamente de la región. Estas condiciones mantendrán un patrón de lluvias intensas hasta al menos mediados de la próxima semana. PUBLICIDAD La vigilancia de posibles inundaciones repentinas permanecerá vigente hasta el sábado, mientras que los vientos del sur disminuirán gradualmente durante el fin de semana, permitiendo que vientos ligeros a moderados del este retornen a inicios de la próxima semana. [NOV 1]— NWS San Juan (@NWSSanJuan) Wet and unstable weather pattern, along w/hazardous marine and coastal conditions, will persist today. Please stay tuned. // Condiciones húmedas e inestable, junto con condiciones marítimas y costeras peligrosas, persistirá hoy. Por favor, manténgase atento. [#PRwx] [#USVIwx] [pic.twitter.com/TgjaACJzlV] [November 1, 2024] Las condiciones marítimas se mantendrán peligrosas hasta el domingo, con un alto riesgo de corrientes de resaca hasta el lunes. Para hoy, nublado con lluvias y tormentas eléctricas aisladas. Temperaturas máximas alrededor de 85°F. Vientos del este de 5 a 10 mph. Probabilidad de lluvia 90 %. Esta noche, mayormente nublado con tormentas eléctricas aisladas y lluvias dispersas. Mínimas alrededor de 77 °F. Vientos del sureste de 5 mph. Probabilidad de lluvia 80 %. El sábado, parcialmente nublado en la mañana, luego nublado. Tormentas aisladas. Lluvias dispersas en la mañana, aumentando a lluvias numerosas por la tarde. Temperaturas máximas alrededor de 91 °F. Vientos del sureste de 10 a 15 mph. Probabilidad de lluvia 70 %. PUBLICIDAD Inundada carretera PR-3 en Yabucoa Agentes, adscritos al distrito de Yabucoa del Negociado de la Policía de Puerto Rico, informaron este viernes, primero de noviembre de 2024, que debido a las inclemencias del mal tiempo, en el kilómetro 95.3 de la carretera PR-3 cerca de las antiguas facilidades de la Central Azucarera de Yabucoa, se encuentra intransitable ya que la vía de rodaje está inundada. Se les exhorta a los conductores que tomen vías alternas, como la autopista PR-53 y carretera 182 y precaución en el área
